newsitem.title: USA: DIMON acquires Intabex for $265.25 mln.
newsitem.headline: DIMON acquires Intabex for $265.25 mln.

text.p: DIMON Inc said on Tuesday that it has completed the acquisition of Intabex Holdings Worldwide SA for $265.25 million in stock, cash and convertible debentures.

Intabex, a privately owned Luxembourg holding company, is the world's fourth leaf tobacco dealer with annual sales of approximately $700 million, DIMON said. DIMON acquired an affiliated company in Zimbabwe in a separate transaction.
DIMON said the purchase consists of 1.70 million shares of DIMON common stock, $140 million in 10-year, 6.25 percent subordinated convertible debentures and $86.12 million in cash.
The convertible debentures can be converted into 4.866 million DIMON shares at $28.77 a share, DIMON said.
